Package boundary

Class UserHandler

java.lang.Object
boundary.UserHandler
public class UserHandler extends Object
Represents a UserHandler which is used to take user input of custom-defined datatypes. Implemented for reuse in multiple methods.

      public static Movie getMovieFromUser()

      Returns:
      Returns movie with the selected movie id.

    • getCineplexFromUser

      public static Cineplex getCineplexFromUser()
      Returns a cineplex by prompting user to choose from a list of available cineplexes.
      Returns:
      Returns the selected cineplex.

    • getCinemaFromUser

      public static Cinema getCinemaFromUser(Cineplex cineplex)
      Returns a cinema by prompting user to choose from a list of available cinema from a given cineplex.
      Parameters:
      cineplex - Given cineplex to select a cinema from.
      Returns:
      Returns the selected cinema.

    • getMovieByTitleFromUser

      public static Movie getMovieByTitleFromUser()
      Returns a movie by prompting user for movie title, then movie id from a list of movies with matching movie title. User needs to input movie id because multiple movies may have the same title, but each movie will have its own unique id.
      Returns:
      Returns the selected movie.

    • getShowingFromUser

      public static Showing getShowingFromUser()
      Returns a showing by prompting user for cineplex and movie, then showing id from a list of showings with matching cineplex and movie. User needs to input showing id because there may be multiple showings for the same movie at the same cineplex.
      Returns:
      Returns the selected showing.

    • getCinemaClassFromUser

      public static Enumerators.CinemaClass getCinemaClassFromUser()
      Returns a cinema class by prompting user to choose from a list of available cinema classes.
      Returns:
      Returns the selected cinema class.

      Returns:
      Returns the selected age category.
